text: *Hey everyone!* I'm having problems migrating my domain to HubSpot, with the Cloudflare host, I updated the DNS records and my site suddenly went down, is this normal? if I just connect to HubSpot all my other previous assets go down? If anyone can help me, I'd be very grateful.

What are you trying to achieve? let's say you have a website <http://www.website.com|www.website.com> where you have your website hosted, if you connect that domain to HubSpot that website will go down (<http://www.website.com|www.website.com> will point to HubSpot now, not to your old web hosting), depending on your use case you could either connect that domain using reverse proxy (content hub enterprise) or connect a subdomain if you just plan to use HubSpot to create landing pages/ blog / side website
So if I'm in the process of migrating all my content to HubSpot, I can only update the DNS records after I've imported my pages into HubSpot?

Yes, so usually steps are:
1. Create pages in HubSpot under the test domain provided
2. Connect domain under settings and set it as ready to publish
3. Upload redirects and check if page domains have been updated correctly
4. Add your dns records to your domain
Okay, thanks a lot, man, you've helped me a lot. Have a great day!
